review_title: Amazing and supportive organisation. Highly reccomend!
pros: Diverse styles of leadership, all embodying the org's values of inclusivity, community, excellence and courage! Flexible working hours, good consideration of wellbeing and a true commitment to staff's personal & professional development.

job_title: Assistant Management Accountant in London, England
pros: Friendly team of Dedicated of professionals

Great to be part of an organisation that makes a different
Lovely people to work alongside
Awesome projects to get involved in
Excellent CEO
cons: Middle Management is poor, micromanaging, unable to delegate tasks effectively, favouritism, inexperienced

review_title: Working in a mid-sized youth charity
job_title: Research and Learning Manager in London, England
pros: Passionate about the work. Work with some great people across the sector
cons: Can be a heavy workload - You will work evenings and weekends as normal

pros: Really passionate people working there, they get a lot of fundraising for the sector
cons: High turnover of staff can cause undue stress on others, chaotic environment

review_title: Youth Charity with hardly any young people working for them??
pros:
The odd staff meeting down in the Countryside gets you away from London for a day and meet staff you would otherwise speak over the phone or email with.

Holidays are easy to take, most of the time was expected with little notice.

Flexible working hours.
cons:
Out of a team of 21 in the London office, I was 1 of 2 'young people' (18-25) which is a bit of a shock when trying to speak up about whats current about young people and no one taking in your ideas.

At the best time, I was 1 of 4 staff members who were BAME and we did stick out quite badly.

3 staff with the same job title earning different salaries and the excuse was 'they have more experience' even though I had been working for the company longer then them.

Senior managers only seem to care about themselves.

pros: UK Youth are a fantastic charity to work for. The people that work at the charity are fantastic and have a real passion for helping young people. When working with people who share the same passion it makes the job much more enjoyable and make the charity's work much more engaging. Overall I felt very supported during my time at UK Youth and if I had the opportunity to work for the charity again I wouldn't hesitate.
cons: Efficiency could be improved to ensure the charities money is spent more wisely. Not much development opportunities within the charity but this is expected with a small charity.

job_title: Head of Partnerships and Fundraising in London, England
pros: I worked at UK Youth for eight years and I absolutely loved it. I found it to be very dynamic, collaborative and most importantly impactful. I had the opportunity to work with some fantastic global partners, be involved in decision making and always felt that I was being stretched and learning new things. The charity evolved considerably during my time there with a new brand, improved processes and programmes for young people and local youth organisations. I definitely recommend this as a great place to work.
cons: Meeting and email heavy culture (but this is being tackled)

review_title: Guest Services Administrator at Avon Tyrrell
job_title: Guest Services Administrator in Bransgore, England
pros:
Lovely and welcoming team
Wonderful surroundings
Hot lunch
cons: I only left because my commute was too long

pros: Laidback environment, access to external trainings, conferences
cons: Heavy workload, favoritism, confused vision. Pretty disorganised.
